metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8545 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libavcodec/pngdec.c in FFmpeg before 2.4.2 accepts the monochrome-black format without verifying that the bits-per-pixel value is 1, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted PNG data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.5.4-1
libav-tools - 7:2.5.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.5.4-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.5.4-1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.5.4-1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.5.4-1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.5.4-1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.5.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.5.4-1').
